lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
* The main class for the Duke Chatbot which serves as the entry point for the whole program. The main business logic
* is conducted by this class, which ties in functionality from all classes to run the whole programme.
* Creates a Duke object that initialises the necessary variables for the execution of the Duke program.
* @param filePath a relative file path giving the location to the data stored in the hard disk
* The method responsible for the main logic of the program.
* The starting point for the program.
* @param args arguments to be passed to the main method. Any array can be used with no change in effect.
* This class is responsible for making Exceptions made specifically for the purpose of the Duke Chatbot.
* These Exceptions are particularly targeted at improper input provided by the users and give a custom message
* based on what the error is.
private static final String BAD_COMMAND_ERROR = "I have literally no idea what you're asking of me. \uD83D\uDE20";
private static final String BAD_TODO_ERROR = "HELLO! Please fill up a description of todo. " +
private static final String BAD_FIND_ERROR = "HELLO! How can I find something if you don't tell me what to find?";
private static final String BAD_DEADLINE_DATE_ERROR = "HELLO! Please fill up due date for the deadline. " +
private static final String BAD_DEADLINE_TASK_ERROR = "HELLO! Please fill up the task for the deadline. " +
private static final String BAD_EVENT_DATE_ERROR = "HELLO! Please fill up the date for the event. " +
private static final String BAD_EVENT_TASK_ERROR = "HELLO! Please fill up the event details. " +
* Initialises a DukeException object with the message that is passed in the argument
* @param message Message that will be used to generate the DukeException
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid input is provided by the user
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad command passed by the user
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid input is provided for the Todo command
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad input is provided for the ToDo command
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid task input is provided for the Deadline command
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad task input is provided for the Deadline command
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid deadline input is provided for the Deadline command
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad deadline input is provided for the Deadline command
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid task input is provided for the Event command
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad task input is provided for the Event command
* Generates a DukeException when an invalid date input is provided for the Event command
* @return DukeException object signifying a bad date input is provided for the Event command
* This enum represents the different types of inputs that can be provided by the user.
* Gives an InputType corresponding to the input string
* @param s String which corresponds to a particular InputType
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad argument for getCommand");
* This class is responsible for parsing the input provided by the user into the respective commands they represent
* Produces a Command object corresponding to the input provided. Throws an exception if invalid input is provided.
* @param input raw string form of a command
* @return Command object representing the command in the input
* @throws DukeException If the input is not a valid command
public Command parse(String input) throws DukeException {
* This class deals with the operations regarding the data stored and needed by the programme
* Initialises a Storage object that represents the data stored in the file path provided
* @param filePath File path containing the location where the data for the program is stored
* @throws IOException If there is an error in Files operations
* Loads the data in the file into a List for easier manipulation
* @return List containing the tasks represented by each line in the data
* @throws FileNotFoundException If file is not found
* @throws DukeException If the data contains invalid tasks
public List<Task> load() throws FileNotFoundException, DukeException {
* Stores the provided TaskList into the data file
* @param tasks TaskList containing the data to be persisted to the hard disk

public void storeTaskList(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {

* Provides the number of tasks in the TaskList

* Removes a task from the TaskList at the specified index
* @param index The index of the Task to be removed

* Prints out a string which gives a greeting to the user
final String HELLO_MESSAGE = "Hello, and welcome to my humble abode. \n" +
"I'm supposed to help you but I'll be the judge of that. Anyway what do you want.";

final String BYE_MESSAGE = "Thank you for that utter waste of time.\n" +
* Prints out all items in the specified TaskList
* @param tasks TaskList consisting of items to be printed
public void printList(TaskList tasks) { printList(tasks, "Here are all your burdens"); }
* Prints out tasks that have been found from a find query
printList(tasks, "Found these for you, couch potato");
